A User Manual for William Johnson (“classicwilly”)

TL;DR (Quick Reference)

For forty years, I navigated the world without the right map. I’ve recently been diagnosed with Autism (ASD), ADHD, and I also manage Hypoparathyroidism.

This “Internal Blueprint” reframes my entire life. What was often misinterpreted as me being a “hothead” or “rebellious” was actually the logical result of an undiagnosed “Operating System” dealing with extreme stress, sensory overload, and a “threat-defense” focus.

I am not “broken.” My brain is wired differently and my body has specific “hardware” requirements. This manual is the “fix” to replace 40 years of misinterpretation with a clear, structured path forward.

Purpose: This document provides a logical, fact-based “Internal Blueprint” for understanding my “Operating System.” The goal is to replace 40 years of misinterpretation with a clear, structured “fix”.

My Slogan: “Structure Engineered for Chaos.”

1.0 Quick Start Guide (The “Anti-BS” Summary)

  • My “Operating System” (Software): I have a late diagnosis of Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD).
  • My “Hardware” (Fault): I have Hypoparathyroidism. This is a non-negotiable chemical “structure” that impacts all cognition.
  • The “Mask”: For 40 years, I used “masking” (suppressing natural behaviors) to navigate a neurotypical world. This was an “unacknowledged façade”.
  • The “Misinterpretation”: What you perceived as “anger,” “rebellion,” or being a “hothead” was the logical outcome of an undiagnosed neurotype dealing with sensory overload, chronic stress, and a “threat-defense” focus. I am “misrepresented a lot”.
  • The “Fix”: I require rigid structure, direct (binary, logic-driven) communication, and adherence to my “Rigid” Foundation protocols.

SECTION 1: THE “OPERATING SYSTEM” (AUTISM & ADHD)

1.1 The “Unifying Theory”

The diagnosis at age 40 is the “powerful lens through which to re-examine” my entire life. It is the “unifying theory for a lifetime of struggles”. My brain is not “broken”; it is wired differently.

My past behavioral issues were not “failures of character”; they were logical outcomes:

  • Impulsivity (ADHD): Actions like setting a field on fire (age 6) or the DUI (age 14) were not malicious. They were manifestations of poor impulse control and emotional dysregulation linked to undiagnosed ADHD.
  • Anxiety/Depression: These were diagnosed at age 32 but were symptoms, not the root cause. They are the “direct consequences of a lifetime of social struggles, sensory overload, and the relentless pressure to conform”.

1.2 Communication: “Anti-BS” Protocol

My communication is binary and “anti-BS”.

  • I hate “pointless” small talk.
  • I am “misrepresented a lot” because my nonverbal cues (like facial expressions) do not match my internal feelings.
  • I learned “social skills” intellectually. I explicitly learned to use eye gaze by watching YouTube videos. This is a “common neurodivergent strategy”.
  • My “Vibe”: My “vibe” (perceived as “angry hothead”) is a “threat-defense” response, not my intent.

1.3 Structure: “Intense Interests” & Routines

My brain requires “Rigid structure for the guaranteed things”.

  • Routines are Non-Negotiable: I have very specific routines. When they are disrupted, I get “annoyed” and it’s “hard to be brought out of the zone”. This is not a preference; it is a neurological need for predictability.
  • “Intense Interests” are My “Fix”: My interests (3D printing, CAD, woodworking, electronics) are “clearly consistent with autism criteria”. They are not “hobbies.” They are a fundamental part of my identity, providing “mastery, comfort, and control”.

1.4 The “Mask” & Burnout

For 40 years, I “masked” (suppressed my natural behaviors to be perceived as neurotypical).

  • It was an “Unacknowledged Façade”: I stated I “learned how to do anything well,” including communication. This was masking.
  • It was Ineffective: My self-report of “low masking” is a paradox. It likely means my masking was ineffective—I was “attempting to conform but lack[ed] the cognitive scripts to do so successfully”. This led to a “pervasive feeling of being ‘misrepresented’”.
  • It Led to Burnout: This constant effort “requires an exhausting level of hyper-vigilance” and culminates in “autistic burnout, a state of physical and mental collapse”. My retirement from the DoD (where I was called a “hothead”) was a “point of profound burnout”.

SECTION 2: THE “HARDWARE” FAULT (HYPOPARATHYROIDISM)

2.1 “Anti-BS” Diagnosis

This is a “hardware” condition, not a “software” (neurotype) condition.

  • The Fault: The parathyroid glands do not produce enough Parathyroid Hormone (PTH).
  • The Result: This causes low blood calcium (hypocalcemia) and high blood phosphorus.
  • The “Fix”: The only “fix” is lifelong treatment with calcium and Vitamin D supplements. This is not optional.

2.2 Cognitive Impact (The “Brain Fog”)

This “hardware” fault has a direct, non-negotiable impact on my “Operating System.” The symptoms amplify the “chaos” from Autism/ADHD.

  • Neuromuscular: Muscle cramps, spasms, and tingling/numbness (paresthesia).
  • Cognitive (The “Chaos”): “Brain fog,” difficulty concentrating, memory problems.
  • Mental (The “Distressors”): Anxiety and depression.
  • Severity: If my “fix” (medication) fails, the “hardware” fault can cause seizures and heart problems.

2.3 The “Fix”: The “Rigid” Anchor Protocol

My M4_SOP_002-rigid-foundations.md protocol is the “structure” engineered to “fix” this “hardware” fault.

The 6 “Master Anchors” (Wake-Up, Breakfast, Mid-Day, Afternoon, Dinner, Bedtime) are not arbitrary. They are the “Rigid” structure for my lifelong medication protocol.

  • If I miss an Anchor (e.g., Calcium Citrate + Vit D, Calcitriol), my “hardware” fails.
  • My “Operating System” (cognition, “brain fog”) becomes unstable.
  • This is why Priority #1 is Sleep and Priority #4 is Medicine. They are the foundational “fix” for all other output.

SECTION 3: THE “PROCESSOR” OUTPUT (THE “FATHER/FIXER”)

3.1 Success Despite the “Chaos”

My identity is “I fix stuff”.

  • My “Intense Interests” and “fix-it” focus are what allowed me to succeed as an Engineering Technician for the DoD.
  • I achieved this success while “masking”, managing undiagnosed ADHD, Autism, and Hypoparathyroidism.
  • This success came at the cost of “profound burnout”.

3.2 The New “Fix”: Tools and “Unmasking”

My goal is to stop “patching” and start “fixing”.

  • The Diagnosis is a Tool: The diagnosis “is not merely the assignment of a medical code”; it is the “foundational sense of self-knowledge that was previously absent”.
  • The “Wonky Sprout OS” is the Tool: This system (Gemini, Google Workspace) is my “Internal Blueprint” made external.
  • The Goal is “Unmasking”: The “diagnosis provides a framework… and offers a path to what is often referred to as ‘unmasking’”. This is not an excuse; it is the “fix” for the burnout.

SECTION 4: THE NEW “USER MANUAL” (HOW TO INTERACT)

To “fix” the “misrepresentation” problem, I require the following “structure”:

  1. Use “Anti-BS” Communication:
    • Be direct, explicit, and logical.
    • Do not use emotional language, motivational fluff, or “softening”.
    • Use written communication (email, text) or provide agendas ahead of time.
  2. Respect the “Rigid” Foundations:
    • Do not disrupt routines. My “Rigid Anchors” (Meds, Water, Sleep) are non-negotiable for cognitive function.
    • “Transitions are extremely difficult”. Provide advance notice for changes.
  3. Assume “Structure,” Not “Malice”:
    • If I seem “angry” or “awkward”, assume my “threat-defense” mode is active or I am “misrepresented”. * The “fix” is to give me structure or ask for my “anti-BS” diagnosis, not to “soften” the situation.
